metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27823 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenJPEGâ€™s encoder. This flaw allows an attacker to pass specially crafted x,y offset input to OpenJPEG to use during encoding. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-27823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
openjpeg2 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu5').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
